alert.note: Alert for Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 26 at 2:41PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Along The Tanana River Into Next Week... High water continues along glacially fed rivers draining the Alaska Range, including the Tanana River. Warm temperatures persisting into the weekend will result in continued glacial and high elevation snowmelt runoff. Additionally, recent heavy rainfall from thunderstorms along the Alaska Range is also contributing additional water in the Tanana River. The high water will cause elevated groundwater along the Tanana River with adjacent sloughs and ponds filling with water. The Tanana River at Fairbanks is near minor flood stage and is expected to fluctuate around this level for the next several days. The Rosie Creek subdivision near Fairbanks may see ponding of water over some roads as groundwater rises to the surface. Heavy rain from thunderstorms over the Interior the next few days will also cause rapid rises on some small streams and rivers, especially the storms that form over steep terrain.

area.areaDesc: Central Interior; Deltana and Tanana Flats; Middle Tanana Valley
